alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Harrison, east central Hancock and Jackson Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Grand Bay to 7 miles southeast of Gulfport. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Moss Point, Bay St. Louis, St. Martin, Diamondhead, Escatawpa, Gautier, D`iberville, Latimer, Big Point, Helena, Gulf Hills, Vancleave, Gulf Park Estates, Hickory Hills, Lyman and Kiln. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 16 and 76. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
